comment.author: 9453335@N02
comment._content: Are there any images of the entrance of the National College of Art and Design, which was entered through the gates to the National Library? I went there in the 70's.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mutter_fluffer] Not that I know of, sorry. That building is now part of the NLI complex - still with a very arty focus. That's where our Prints & Drawings collections and P&D Reading Room is, in addition to the Yeats exhibition and the NLI Seminar/Lecture Room...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47044499@N03
comment._content: Magnificent - a great image of a superb builing.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lizinitaly] No problem! And you're not alone in admiring our "facilities" - there are regular outbursts of appreciation on Twitter under #LooWatch ...  :)

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: The National Library of Ireland, and the Museum opposite, were designed by the well known Cork architects, Sir Thomas Newenham Deane, and his son Sir Thomas Manly Deane.
